description:
8.37 anequalizer
High-order parametric multiband equalizer for each channel.

It accepts the following parameters:
name: anequalizer

options.description:
This option string is in format: "cchn f=cf w=w g=g t=f | ..." Each equalizer band is separated by ’|’.

chn

Set channel number to which equalization will be applied. If input doesn’t have that channel the entry is ignored.

f

Set central frequency for band. If input doesn’t have that frequency the entry is ignored.

w

Set band width in Hertz.

g

Set band gain in dB.

t

Set filter type for band, optional, can be:

‘0’

Butterworth, this is default.

‘1’

Chebyshev type 1.

‘2’

Chebyshev type 2.
options.name: params

options.description: With this option activated frequency response of anequalizer is displayed in video stream.
options.name: curves

options.description: Set video stream size. Only useful if curves option is activated.
options.name: size

options.description: Set max gain that will be displayed. Only useful if curves option is activated. Setting this to a reasonable value makes it possible to display gain which is derived from neighbour bands which are too close to each other and thus produce higher gain when both are activated.
options.name: mgain

options.description: Set frequency scale used to draw frequency response in video output. Can be linear or logarithmic. Default is logarithmic.
options.name: fscale

options.description: Set color for each channel curve which is going to be displayed in video stream. This is list of color names separated by space or by ’|’. Unrecognised or missing colors will be replaced by white color.
options.name: colors
